newsitem.title: HAITI: Haitian bystander wounded in attack on a UN vehicle.
newsitem.headline: Haitian bystander wounded in attack on a UN vehicle.

text.p: Gunmen shot in the direction of a United Nations vehicle Saturday afternoon in a Port-au-Prince slum on Saturday, wounding a passenger on a passing bus.
At least 10 gunshots were fired into the street. The bus driver panicked, drove against traffic and almost hit another bus. A correspondent for Reuters witnessed the attack.
Bus passenger Philip Egienne was shot in the back, but was able to flag down an ambulance.
"They were shooting at a United Nations pickup," said the driver. "I was going right through it so I figured I better just drive."
No injuries or news of the attack were reported to U.N. representatives, according to U.N. spokeswoman Patricia Tome. She said officials were looking into the matter.
